p: The results of sensory evaluation (color, aroma, and overall acceptability) of ostrich meat samples kept at 4°C are shown in Figure 5a–c. In this way, ostrich meat samples with a score above 4 can be accepted (Hansen et al., 1995; Nisar et al., 2019). Sensory scores (color) less than 4 were observed for control and QSSM samples on day 9. For the QSSM + LO samples, the retention score by day 9 was greater than 4 (Figure 5a).
